Text:
Lambda had given Number 666 a task. But try as she
might to cleave a boulder in two within the week she
had been givenâ€”
Haaah!!!
...Another failure. All I'm doing is smashing them.

(It's been four days...and I haven't made any
progress. I knew it wouldn't be easy, but I
never thought I'd struggle this much.)
What is it I'm missing here...

(I have to become stronger... If I don't, then I'll
lose even more, face even more heartbreak.)

(...But how do I do that? What is it I need to do?
I don't even know what it is that I lack...)

(...No. I can't lose myself to uncertainty and fear
again. At times like these, I just need to stay calm.)
Whew...

(Maybe it's a sign of how weak-hearted I am that
I get upset so easily.)

(...I need to rethink this with a calm head and heart.
Why am I failing to cut the boulder, and what can I
do to change that.)
The swordplay I seek is...

Number 666 turns her mind to a memory from the past,
to the graceful swordsmanship she witnessed amidst
the terror and confusion of that day.

(What I saw that day was much more refined and
precise, yet also free of excess.)

(The person I'd aspired to for so long..he bestowed
me with power, but I haven't been able to put it to
any use at all... What is it that makes he and I so
different...)

"Do not forget. True strength does not come from
power, but from within you."
...True strength?

(That's right... The way he swung his sword, it wasn't
with magic-infused brute force, but...)
And then, the day arrives.

It's been a week. Judging by your face, I take it
you've had a breakthrough.
Now, Number 666! Show me what you've learned!
Yes, ma'am!
Magic slowly flows into Rose's sword.

(Her magic is calm, not rough like before. Looks like
she really has figured something out.)
...Yaaah!!!

With a yell, Number 666 cleaves the boulder in two
with her blade.
...Phew. How was that?

...Not quite perfect. You spent too much time
preparing, which isn't practical.

But...it's a world of difference from that sloppy
display you put on last time. Good work.
*gasp* Thank you!

So, Number 666, did you realize anything while
practicing?

Well...I compared the beautiful swordsmanship I saw
in the past with my own here in the present.

I suppose my abilities are approaching what I saw
that day. That...perhaps they are no longer a
mockery, a pale imitation.

As I thought back on that memory, I realized that his
movements were graceful and subtle, not brash and
emotional like mine.

It's not amassing huge amounts of magic that
matters... Until now I was too focused on what
I was missing, to the point that I failed to see
how futile that was.

("True strength does not come from power, but from
within you." I think I understand those words a little
better now. You saved me yet again...)

...Correct. Magic is not a blunt instrument where the
more you pile on, the better. You need to be able to
wield it properly.
Never forget that.
Yes, ma'am!

(This is the first time I've felt results since
coming to the Shadow Garden.)

(If I keep this up, I will become stronger! Then, one
day, I can save my homeland...)
